SerialConnection
SerialConnection

A Connection_Impl derived class that represents a serial connection.

Functions
SerialConnection
explicit SerialConnection(
const std::
string& 
port,
uint32 
baudRate
)

Initializes the SerialConnection object.

Parameters
port
const std::string&

The actual string name of the COM port (ex. "COM26")

baudRate
uint32

The baud rate at which to open the COM port.

Exceptions

  • Error_InvalidSerialPort: the specified com port is invalid

  • Error_Connection: failed to get or set com port parameters

~SerialConnection
~SerialConnection() override = default

Destroys the SerialConnection object

Variables
m_port
std::string m_port

The string name of the port (ex. "COM26")

m_baudRate
uint32 m_baudRate

The baud rate of the connection

Functions
description
std::string description() override

Gets a description of the connection as a string

Returns

A description of the connection

port
std::string port() const override

Gets a name of the connection port

Returns

The port name of the connection

updateBaudRate
void updateBaudRate(
uint32 
baudRate
) override

Updates the serial connection baud rate.  Important: The connection to the port will be closed and re-opened at the new baud rate.

Parameters
baudRate
uint32

the baud rate at which to reestablish the connection

Exceptions

  • Error_Connection: a connection error has occurred, such as the device being unplugged.

establishConnection
void establishConnection() override

Initializes and opens the current connection

Exceptions

  • Error_InvalidSerialPort: the specified com port is invalid

  • Error_Connection: failed to get or set com port parameters
